result.execSummary:
The defendant Teena M. Piotrowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intentional Dognapping or Catnapping, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 951.03.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Teena M. Piotrowski

Case Called: 10:21 am
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Ben Vechinski in person.
Defendant appears in person and with Atty Peter Vu in person.
VRCW.
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. State moves to:
Ct. 1 (BJ-Felony)>>DRI.
Ct. 3 (Criminal Damage to Property)>>DRI.
COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA: 
Ct. 2 (Intentional Dognapping or Catnapping)>> NO CONTEST.
Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: 
Ct. 2 (Intentional Dognapping or Catnapping)>> Sentence W/H- 1 Year Probation. CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, No Contact with Victim A.C.H., Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge. Court finds 0 Days Credit. No objection for transfer of Probation to County of Residence.
